job_title: RN Case Manager in East Cleveland, OH
pros: A team approach to nursing, everyone willing to help each other with difficult patients. Other than that, the pro is.... You made it through your shift alive and not beaten up!! You were told to keep the patients out of seclusion despite their dangerous behavior!! We had criminals mixed in with depressed people mixed in with someone's grandma!! What a great set up!!!
cons: If you take this job and get beat up by a patient.... The hospital will tell you "When you took this job you should have known you had the chance to get hurt". While working here, they began accepting criminals who should have gone to jail, but showed up on our front step instead. One day, a prisoner arrived and beat his nurse until she was unrecognizable! The hospital hid behind their corporate lawyers! This poor nurse has PTSD and can't return because of how severely she was assaulted. The hospital knew how dangerous this floor was, but refused to put security on the floor because of how the "psychiatric patients would feel" Nurses were constantly begging for a security guard to sit up on the floor for protection!!! Taking this job would be a big mistake!! Go work with a population that is less dangerous because you will not be given compensation for any injury .....so it is not worth it!!! Let someone else get their livelihood taken away!!

pros: I can't say enough good things about working at AGMC.  I have always regretted leaving.  I worked my way through school while there and they were good about working around my schedule so I did not lose hours.  Great boss, good department.
cons: I had a tough time moving up until I went to school to be an RN and then I ended up in a job that required the RN but quite honestly should have been done by a business person.

review_title: Good experience overall, not the best pay.
job_title: Personal Trainer in West Akron, OH
pros: The place has everything you need to train your clients.  Never had a problem getting new clients to train.  A lot of room to train in.
cons: The pay wasn't the best.  Also, a lot of the gym visitors are not the usual crowd.  A lot of people coming out of surgeries and post rehab.  Makes for a different vibe than a traditional gym.

review_title: Smallest hospital in Ohio, but able to provide the greatest care
job_title: RN Staff Nurse in Lodi, OH
pros: Friendly staff and co-workers; awesome therapy dept, very neat and tidy facility; Able to provide primary nursing care with ease. Nurse to patient ratio 1:4 (dayshift). It was a very nice place to work! I never really had a bad day when working there.
cons: There is only one nursing floor and smaller ER. I wanted "more experience" and decided to leave....now I am kicking myself.

pros: Benefits, Patients and peers great to work with.  Food Courts are nice, opportunities to grow and change from within departmentally also
cons: Tough with expanding offices when you are understaffed leads to mistakes and your reprimand as an employee.  Needs updating technologically on main campuses in Akron.

pros: Hourly pay and medical benefits.
cons: No advancement/NO leadership/no universal enforcement of policy. Policy is selectively enforced. No sense of direction with leadership that has no qualities to lead in the first place. They will promote from the outside and very rarely promote from within.

review_title: I learned a lot working here, the experience was a wonderful opportunity and experience.
pros: My co- workers were wonderful.
cons: After I had my TIA i wish ?I could've returned to my job, they held it for 8 months but had to hire someone else until i finally got my Doctor's ok to return.

job_title: Senior Cardiovascular Technician in Akron, OH
pros: Akron General Hospital is a great place to work. Akron General abide by their mission statement and that is to improve the health and lives of their patients and the community. They are a well organized well ran organization that I have enjoyed working with for 25 years.
cons: I do not have any

job_title: RN Case Manager in Akron, OH
pros: Super nice, caring and compassionate staff.  Everyone from nurses to therapists are knowledgeable and excellent clinicians.
cons: Not valued as an employee.  Too much management turnover.  New management comes in several times per year and wants to change to "their" way of doing things.  They never consult the staff.  Have unreasonable expectations and do not listen to suggestions by staff.

pros: A good place to work, overall. In the midst of huge changes with the Cleveland Clinic ownership leading to some uncertainty about the future.
cons: Lots of changes with Cleveland Clinic and more questions than answers about the future of some positions and people.

review_title: If micromanagement, phony upper management and a sub-par hospital is your thing, this place is perfect
pros: The only perk is the employee gym.
cons: In order to be successful here, you must drink the kool aid and be a lemming. If you have any ideas outside of the box of upper management, you will not succeed here. Not only that, the hospital environment is very dirty. I personally saw some of the filthiest things in this hospital I've ever seen.

pros: There is job security with scheduled yearly raises of around 1-3%. Very good learning environment because it is a teaching hospital. Doctors and nurses overall seem nice and helpful.
cons: They do not pay a competitive salary.  Long hours not worth the low salary. Not a lot of growth potential.

pros: Easy welcoming job , good pay and great staff to help you feel appreciated , and great benefits as well which Is good
cons: Hours scheduled to work other then that great job , picking up other managers slack may be challenging and finding parking for work

cons: Overload. Do more with the same amount of time. New ongoing responsibilities piled on almost weekly These seem to be management strategies.

review_title: Great benefits, competitive pay, very strict attendance
pros: Benefits are the best around. Pay is way better than private practice.
cons: Attendance policy is strict. You have to be under 2% of time off out of accumulated work hours. Every 2% violation is a write up.

pros: Manager and staff very nice depending on you unit, they give bonuses for coming in which is very nice usually 25$ per 4 hours worked
cons: Parking is usually far and not in a great area

pros: Pay is good. Benefits are great. 401k managed well.
cons: Completely a bullying environment. Don't be a whistle-blower or they will quickly make sure you leave. Union is useless except for collecting high dues from your paycheck.

pros: Their benefits were fantastic!  The health care was 100%
